newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Heraklith sees drop in 1996 net profit.
newsitem.headline: Heraklith sees drop in 1996 net profit.

text.p: Austrian insulation materials maker Heraklith Holding, a unit of listed Radex-Heraklith Industriebeteiligungs AG, said it expects full-year net profit to drop by 22 percent amid a Europe-wide slump in construction.

The company said in a statement it expected net profit to fall to around 125 million schillings in 1996, from 160 million last year. It added sales should inch down to 4.2 billion schillings from 4.252 billion a year ago.
"The exceptionally good result of the previous year will not be matched because of the overall weak economy which had negative effects on construction activity across Europe," it said.

Heraklith added it would invest some 265 million schillings in setting up a production facility in Canada, a joint venture with Fiber Rock Canada Ltd. In South Africa, the group said it would invest some 46.5 million schillings in a joint venture production facility with Lignacem in Johannesburg. -- Vienna newsroom +431 53112 274
